text:
We're one step closer to a Covid-19 vaccine for ages 5-11. The advisory committee to the @US_FDA voted to recommended authorization of the @pfizer vaccine for this age group. Your child COULD be eligible as early as next week.

I spoke with @NPR’s @rachelnpr about my new book out tomorrow, #WorldWarC. Emerging pathogens are inevitable; pandemics are not. https://t.co/DhBKYwMbiO

Does wealth buy health? If there’s something #Covid19 has taught us: It’s one thing for a country to have a lot of resources. It’s another to make use of what resources they do have. More in my new book, #WorldWarC https://t.co/74GHyYgHrR https://t.co/2zsZaEHooO

In order to best heal the body, you have to first heal the mind. It is a lesson I have learned as a neurosurgeon, and it is also critical to becoming “pandemic proof.”

Here’s how I approach building a better brain in WORLD WAR C: https://t.co/BXKhMocAUw

RT @AC360: The US has surpassed 700,000 Covid-19 deaths.

"So many of these deaths were preventible," says @DrSanjayGupta. "It was inaction…

When it comes to people who are choosing not to get vaccinated — especially health care workers — it’s something I worry about. Where does that leave us for the next pandemic? How to build trust? It’s something I spent a lot of time researching for my new book, #WorldWarC https://t.co/jlkjNmRiyA

Ever wonder why we have lots of antibiotics but not so many antivirals? I discuss that, the unique “proofreading” ability of Covid-19, and what it all means for the latest news from @Merck @jaketapper https://t.co/K3c0I649xh
